required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The DDI Study Had Been Designed to Investigate the Effect of SHR3680 on the Pharmacokinetics of Midazolam, S-Warfarin and Omeprazole
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center, Open-label, Fixed-sequence Phase I Drug-drug Interaction Clinical Study to Investigate the Pharmacokinetics of SHR3680 With Midazolam （CYP3A4 Substrates), S-Warfarin (CYP2C9 Substrates) and Omeprazole (CYP2C19 Substrates) in Prostate Cancer Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The DDI study had been designed to investigate the effect of SHR3680 on the pharmacokinetics of Midazolam, S-Warfarin and Omeprazole

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics parameters of Midazolam, S-Warfarin and Omeprazole
Pharmacokinetics parameters of Midazolam, S-Warfarin and Omeprazole
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC)

arm_group.description: administrate Midazolam, Warfarin, Omeprazole, VitaminK1 on Day1 and Day22, SHR3680 on day 6-27.

intervention.intervention_name: Midazolam, Warfarin, Omeprazole, VitaminK1 and SHR3680
intervention.description: Experimental: Midazolam, Warfarin, Omeprazole, VitaminK1 and SHR3680 Midazolam, Warfarin, Omeprazole and VitaminK1 QD on Day 1 and Day 22, SHR3680 240 mg once daily (QD) from Study Day 6 - 27
